item.title: S. 500, Beaufort, South Carolina, Study Act of 2003
item.description: Cost estimate for the bill as ordered reported by the Senate Committee on Energy and Natural Resources on May 21, 2003

item.title: S. 500, Beaufort, South Carolina, Study Act of 2003
item.description: Cost estimate for the bill as ordered reported by the Senate Committee on Energy and Natural Resources on May 21, 2003

summary.text:
Beaufort, South Carolina, Study Act of 2003 - Directs the Secretary of the Interior to conduct a special resource study and report to specified congressional committees on the suitability and feasibility of designating the area comprised of historical sites in the historic district of Beaufort, South Carolina, relating to the Reconstruction Era as a unit of the National Park System (NPS).

Requires the Secretary to conduct and report to specified congressional committees on a national historic landmark theme study to identify sites and resources in the United States that are significant to the Reconstruction Era. Requires such study to include recommendations for commemorating and interpreting identified sites and resources, including sites that should be nominated as national historic landmarks and sites for which further study for potential inclusion in the NPS should be authorized.

Beaufort County, South Carolina, Study Act of 2003 - Directs the Secretary of the Interior to conduct a special resource study and report to Congress on the suitability and feasibility of designating the area comprised of historical sites in Beaufort County, South Carolina, relating to the Reconstruction Era as a unit of the National Park System (NPS).

Requires the Secretary to conduct and report to Congress on a national historic landmark theme study to identify sites and resources in the United States that are significant to the Reconstruction Era. Requires such study to include recommendations for commemorating and interpreting identified sites and resources, including sites that should be nominated as national historic landmarks and sites that warrant further study for potential inclusion in the NPS.

Authorizes appropriations.

(This measure has not been amended since it was reported to the Senate on June 9, 2003. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

Beaufort County, South Carolina, Study Act of 2003 - Directs the Secretary of the Interior to conduct a special resource study and report to Congress on the suitability and feasibility of designating the area comprised of historical sites in Beaufort County, South Carolina, relating to the Reconstruction Era as a unit of the National Park System (NPS).

Requires the Secretary to conduct and report to Congress on a national historic landmark theme study to identify sites and resources in the United States that are significant to the Reconstruction Era. Requires such study to include recommendations for commemorating and interpreting identified sites and resources, including sites that should be nominated as national historic landmarks and sites that warrant further study for potential inclusion in the NPS.

Authorizes appropriations.

bill.title: Beaufort County, South Carolina, Study Act of 2003

item.title: Beaufort County, South Carolina, Study Act of 2003
A bill to direct the Secretary of the Interior to study certain sites in the historic district of Beaufort, South Carolina, relating to the Reconstruction Era.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
